00011 #include <mlpack/core.hpp>

00013 namespace mlpack {
00014 namespace gmm {
00015 
00031 inline double phi(const double x, const double mean, const double var)
00032 {
00033   return exp(-1.0 * ((x - mean) * (x - mean) / (2 * var)))
00034       / sqrt(2 * M_PI * var);
00035 }
00036 
00053 inline double phi(const arma::vec& x,
00054                   const arma::vec& mean,
00055                   const arma::mat& cov)
00056 {
00057   arma::vec diff = mean - x;
00058 
00059   arma::vec exponent = -0.5 * trans(diff) * inv(cov) * diff;
00060 
00061   // TODO: What if det(cov) < 0?
00062   return pow(2 * M_PI, (double) x.n_elem / -2.0) * pow(det(cov), -0.5) *
00063       exp(exponent[0]);
00064 }
00065 
00078 inline double phi(const arma::vec& x,
00079                   const arma::vec& mean,
00080                   const arma::mat& cov,
00081                   const std::vector<arma::mat>& d_cov,
00082                   arma::vec& g_mean,
00083                   arma::vec& g_cov)
00084 {
00085   // We don't call out to another version of the function to avoid inverting the
00086   // covariance matrix more than once.
00087   arma::mat cinv = inv(cov);
00088 
00089   arma::vec diff = mean - x;
00090   arma::vec exponent = -0.5 * trans(diff) * inv(cov) * diff;
00091 
00092   long double f = pow(2 * M_PI, (double) x.n_elem / 2) * pow(det(cov), -0.5)
00093       * exp(exponent[0]);
00094 
00095   // Calculate the g_mean values; this is a (1 x dim) vector.
00096   arma::vec invDiff = cinv * diff;
00097   g_mean = f * invDiff;
00098 
00099   // Calculate the g_cov values; this is a (1 x (dim * (dim + 1) / 2)) vector.
00100   for (size_t i = 0; i < d_cov.size(); i++)
00101   {
00102     arma::mat inv_d = cinv * d_cov[i];
00103 
00104     g_cov[i] = f * dot(d_cov[i] * invDiff, invDiff) +
00105         accu(inv_d.diag()) / 2;
00106   }
00107 
00108   return f;
00109 }
00110 
00121 inline void phi(const arma::mat& x,
00122                 const arma::vec& mean,
00123                 const arma::mat& cov,
00124                 arma::vec& probabilities)
00125 {
00126   // Column i of 'diffs' is the difference between x.col(i) and the mean.
00127   arma::mat diffs = x - (mean * arma::ones<arma::rowvec>(x.n_cols));
00128 
00129   // Now, we only want to calculate the diagonal elements of (diffs' * cov^-1 *
00130   // diffs).  We just don't need any of the other elements.  We can calculate
00131   // the right hand part of the equation (instead of the left side) so that
00132   // later we are referencing columns, not rows -- that is faster.
00133   arma::mat rhs = -0.5 * inv(cov) * diffs;
00134   arma::vec exponents(diffs.n_cols); // We will now fill this.
00135   for (size_t i = 0; i < diffs.n_cols; i++)
00136     exponents(i) = exp(accu(diffs.unsafe_col(i) % rhs.unsafe_col(i)));
00137 
00138   probabilities = pow(2 * M_PI, (double) mean.n_elem / -2.0) *
00139       pow(det(cov), -0.5) * exponents;
00140 }
00141 
00142 }; // namespace gmm
00143 }; // namespace mlpack
00144 
00145 #endif
